26 package de.general.json;
27 
28 
29 /**
30 * The JSONException is thrown by the JSON.org classes when things are amiss.
31 *
32 * @author JSON.org
33 * @version 2013-02-10
34 */
35 class JSONException extends RuntimeException
36 {
37 
38     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
39     // Constants
40     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
41 
42     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
43     // Variables
44     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
45 
46     private static final long serialVersionUID = 0;
47     private Throwable cause;
48 
49     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
50     // Constructors
51     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
52 
53     /**
54     * Constructs a JSONException with an explanatory message.
55     *
56     * @param message
57     * Detail about the reason for the exception.
58     */
59     protected JSONException(String message) {
60         super(message);
61     }
62 
63     /**
64     * Constructs a new JSONException with the specified cause.
65     */
66     public JSONException(Throwable cause) {
67         super(cause.getMessage());
68         this.cause = cause;
69     }
70 
71     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
72     // Methods
73     ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
74 
75     /**
76     * Returns the cause of this exception or null if the cause is nonexistent
77     * or unknown.
78     *
79     * @returns the cause of this exception or null if the cause is nonexistent
80     * or unknown.
81     */
82     public Throwable getCause() {
83         return this.cause;
84     }
85 
86 }
  JavaDoq: JSONException.java
